content.description: The left set of ring bolts on the large boulder across from the cave, definitely deserving of a good bit more love. The climbing is good fun, dynamic and bouldery, with a beached whale finish. A good romp, get on it!
content.location: The large boulder on your right when walking into Beauty

content.description:
Green Envy features some long bouldery moves split by good shakes.

Begin by navigating through some chossy ledges to a short overhanging arete feauture.  The crux moves hit you right off the bat as you battle up a couple edges to a decent hold just below the head wall.  Pulling on to the head wall is very bouldery.  The beginning of the headwall involves lots of long powerful traversing moves.  The climbing lets up a little as you progress up the headwall, but the moves remain reachy.  Enjoy nice pockets and edges on fine stone.

Recommend stick clipping the second bolt.
content.location: This route is the next route left of the bolted crack "disturbance."

content.description:
A nice little roped boulder problem that features some power endurance movement and cool Red River-esque features.

Stick clip, pounce off the ground and persevere through a series of tension moves up the steeply overhung face. Take care clipping bolt three, and then keep it together for the final move - a nipple-removing mantle onto a forty-five degree slab.
content.protection: Burly glue-ins to a bolt anchor with some tat.
content.location: A separate boulder directly across the trail from the route Genocide. The overhung face of the boulder holds two routes; Mongoloid is the right one.

content.description: Continuous climbing with a distinct crux right in the middle. The crux involves delicate moves to get established in the crack followed by a long move between good pods.
content.location: Starts on face to the left of left facing corner before the face with all the classic crack climbs. Follow bolts past a small bulge to a crack with pods up gently overhanging face.

climbs.name: [Redacted]
climbs.fa: Phil Wilt, Mike Artz 1983.  Entire line: Chick Holtcamp 1987

content.description: At the far left end of the "Genocide Cave" is its namesake route, Genocide. A somewhat scruffy, poweful overhanging face leads to a stance in an alcove. Clip the only bolt on the route at about 30 feet, breathe a sigh of relief, and ready yourself for the cruxy exit to establish a stance at the base of the beautiful finger/thin hands crack. This is what you live for, or hopefully so. A 10 foot section of thin finger locks gains you easier crack climbing. Gain your composure through this section as you ready yourself for one last thinker move.
content.protection: An onsight would be proud and very bold. With that said, climb smart. The top protects fine, the bottom is the issue. You can protect the bottom adequately but should you not get the crucial piece or botch the clip and fall, you are looking at groundfall potential. Make sure your belayer is attentive and knows the deal. 1 bolt. Bolted anchor.
content.location: Left end of the Genocide cave,just left of McCray Fish and Chips.
